page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: For those without cars,transport is very difficult.The local garage runs a coach servce to Plymouth 3 times a week;to an out of town superstore once a week;and to Liskeard twice a month. During term time,coaches take children to Looe each day and students to the Mid Cornwall College at St Austell.The public can also use these services,but the times are inconvenient for most people. 8 trains a day run on the branch line from Looe(5mls) to Liskeard which connects with the main line,but very few 'Plinters'use the service. Our survey(59% return) shows that 65% travel to work by car;17% by lorry;6% by motorbike.The remainder walk. A number of village groups have combined to purchase a 15 seat minibus and this is in regular use.The Lions Club of Looe also have a bus available
